Description.Name: Threading the Fringe
Description.Details: In the Argo’s command deck, final checks scroll across every screen. Supplies are loaded. Mechbays sealed. The navmap shows a jagged arc of jumps leading rimward—through ghost systems, salvage worlds, and quiet stars barely catalogued. Sumire frowns at the plotted course. “We’ll be lucky if half the stations we refuel at even have working lights.” Darius mutters, “If Jorgensson's intel is right, we’re heading straight into the mouth of something that’s been brewing for decades.” Yang doesn’t look up from his screen. “Then let’s not keep it waiting.” Melidronis far. Beyond reach of most traders, far from any safe harbor. But the coordinates are set. The time to go is now.

Description.Name: Immediately travel to Melidron
Description.Details: Custozza fades behind as the Argo begins a long chain of JumpShip transfers, leaping system to system, deeper into the forgotten edges of known space. There are no patrol routes out here. No major trade lanes. Only cold stars, flickering signals, and systems long abandoned or never truly mapped. Melidron lies ahead—hidden past the Flying Bat Nebula, rarely spoken of, never visited. Each jump stretches the line between the crew and everything familiar. And whatever’s waiting at the end… it has kept itself hidden for a reason.

Description.Name: Delay the travel
Description.Details: Even though duty calls, there are things to wrap up. Melidron will have to wait for a bit more. You just hope that it won't lead to any bad outcomes. [A new flashpoint has been created in the Melidron system to continue the campaign]
